answers.answer: Hi,I think you need to see your doctor and explain what's happening.you should be tested for diabetes (HA1C) and also thyroid (FT3, FT4, TSH) as beginning.   A good physical examination should also be carried out.How are your cycles?  You could also have PCOS, which makes it hard to lose weight.LEt us know how you go.

Hi Shars:I managed to lose about 100lbs with the metabolism of a reptile. I started off eating 900 calories a day, because I didn't bother to count them until later, and started with three days a week at the gym. The workout took me two hours and I started with 20 minutes on the treadmill at a pace that was an effort to maintain, and the rest was weights.The first few weeks, I did not lose any weight. I then upped my caloric intake to 1200 calories a day, and the gym to five days a week, and the weight slowly started to come off. I should say I really had to push myself at the gym. If the treadmill became easier, I made it hard again by increasing the speed or incline.Even with my FT4 levels normal, I still have the metabolism of a reptile.

Have you looked at your FT3 levels?  I was on a full daily replacement amount of T4 meds, and still had lingering hypo symptoms (including low metabolism), with my FT4 at the top end of the range.  After I got into this Forum and found out about the importance of testing and adjusting FT3 levels, I have since found that my FT3 was on the very low end of the range.  After I added in a source of T3 to my meds and got the level into the upper part of the range I now feel best ever.
